topic.title: New in-browser decentralized torrent site - theofflinebay.org
topic.body:
Hi all.  I would like to introduce the first in-browser WebTorrent based decentralized torrent site: The Offline Bay
https://theofflinebay.org

Searches and results are fully decentralized via a 'database' torrent.
Contains 5 million alive torrents (out of 55 million). The Pirate Bay contains 1.5 million alive torrents for comparison.
Fully downloadable (700 MB) for a fast, portable, and offline version that requires NO installation (.html based).
Saves downloaded parts of the 'database' torrent in-browser.  The more you search, the faster it becomes.

Cons:
A search with results can use several MB of bandwidth.  This amount of bandwidth makes loading take a few seconds depending on download speed.
Domain and homepage are centralized.  Both will be decentralized in the future.
In development, minor bugs.

Fire away with any questions or comments. I don't count torrent-paradise.ml as being decentralized due to IPFS not being supported in most browsers, whereas WebTorrent is supported in all.

1617087999_16u7ApvQbcH9sGVJV5ELBvY1AQiZL.body:
> [baduser](#comment_31_1KTDVd4rtqErz3FcxPx2nTmr4CSR9Q7hcr): Doesn't work in Brave with shields enabled. I searched for "ubuntu", it says "ubuntu returned 681 results 0 results loaded", nothing else is displayed. Clicking the button "20 More Results" doesn't show anything too. The console is full of errors like this: [...]

Thanks for that.  The only way I can see around this problem is to have a separate database torrent (1.4GB) which is only used by TOR and Brave Shields Up users.  This will make loading almost twice as slow for TOR and Brave Shields Up users.

> [kapec](#comment_95_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): Would be nice to have it mirrored here also

I want to add it here and as a hidden service too.  It should be relatively straight forward to upload the downloadable version to ZeroNet.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3042_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It looks like you're using tech that I tweeted about. Very nice site. Could use some more styling (CSS), but it works great anyway.

Thank you.  Yeah, CSS isn't our strong point.

> [krzysztof113](#comment_38_1Kzonk6v6ccFT3adLkCHoKJhGnoW1UhvY5): Is there somewhere a not minimized version?

No sorry, it's closed source for now.  The plan is to open source the javascript, along with the torrent/tracker data (over 62 million torrents so far) so others can build their own torrent site from our data.  If there's demand, probably an open source torrent site so anyone can build a fully fledged torrent site easily, which was the original project but I focused on a decentralized site instead.
We've just updated the database with the latest torrents.

Just updated with:
- The latest torrents and seed counts.
- "Top 250 Torrents" button.
- Foreign language search support (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Spanish, etc).

Updated!
 - New database design: 5x more efficient, uses a fraction of the data, much faster.
 - Latest torrents and stats as of 19 May.
 - Torrents tracked by 21 trackers, up from 7.
 - 7 million alive torrents.
 - Works with Brave Shields Up and TOR.
 - Offline version no longer updated (due to the new database design). Old version still downloadable.
 - Removed TPB descriptions due to our primary torrent source now being DHT.
 - 4 largest files for each torrent only.

> [mozez](#comment_5_13ui1ziWUVZb7giGNYpAzHzdfCirkobc8x): Unless it's not an option, are there plans for a .onion hidden service or an i2p option for browsing & torrenting?

No sorry, this is designed to be decentralized, not anonymous.  In fact, I will likely drop TOR support soon due to it relying on a webseed for it to work.

> [calmdownholden](#comment_71_17acbn9sNyYyLJrLfSz3KJxqonKZtgVxCD): Sounds like a hack trap.

How so?  Too good to be true?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1032_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Downloaded: 160 KiBUploaded: 0 BPeers: 4Firefox canâ€™t establish a connection to the server at wss://tracker.openwebtorrent.com/. 2 theofflinebay.org:10:346013Torrent warning: Error: Error connecting to wss://tracker.openwebtorrent.com    _handleError https://theofflinebay.org/:10    onerror https://theofflinebay.org/:10 [...]

That just means the tracker is down, it's online most of the time.  I use two trackers at the moment (one hosted by myself) but need to increase that amount for redundancy.

To test it is working, open another tab and make the same search, or a search that returns the same results and you should upload to yourself.

The main selling point of this project is that it requires no download, and no special requirements at all. The database is decentralized, meaning the the core data of the site (the torrents) are safe from censorship.  While the domain or host could be targeted, the core data will remain intact, and anyone can easily host the 1MB .html file or share it around (you can save it to your desktop and it will work as normal - you can't do that with any other torrent site).  There is not decentralized updating at the moment, but I will be able to implement this through Web2Web.

This database has 7 million 'alive' torrents (the pirate bay is around 2 million alive for comparison).  The amount of torrents I'm tracking is 73 million, of which I have searchable titles for roughly 30 million.  So about 3/4 of my torrents are excluded. This database gives even the biggest torrent sites in the world a run for their money.

I would like to introduce a live database that is updated real time (70 million torrents) and have this decentralized database as a backup.  The only reason I haven't so far is because I need to filter out cp in real-time, but I'm working on that issue.

> [bats](#comment_109_1QvU5RXqw5mjgR3BZV5rkc2ju6NHXpGnp): What exactly is 'webseed' and why is relying on it a problem? Do you have suggestions for alternative ways of maintaining anonymity if you decide to stop supporting tor?

A webseed is centralized, and if I'm hosting a webseed I might as well as host a full on server. I'd rather just host the .html file using GitHub pages/Cloudflare and have no server at all.

For anonymity you can download the offline version, which I (indefinitely) no longer support, as it doesn't use any internet.

> [progi](#comment_20_17KQehVm2u5r4GAjqkC3jRcxepzK6ri51W): This is not decentralized. Users do not seed the full content just part of the content, and only when the browser are running. The central server is only helped with seeds when too much users use the service on heavy traffic. If the central server shuts down, the entire service shuts down slowly. Where users do not  seed the full content, just parts of them, none of the services there decentralized. Web torrent are not a solution to that to the users 100% keep online the content without a central non-stop running server.

The database is decentralized.  It relies on people like yourself to host the database torrent in a WebTorrent supported client such as WebTorrent Desktop or BiglyBT. Currently there are about 3-4 WebTorrent seeders of the database in torrent clients (not browser).
You can find more information and the database torrent download link on the 'Search' page at theofflinebay.org (next to 'About Us').  I will make this more obvious on the website next update. Thanks for the feedback.

> [bats](#comment_110_1QvU5RXqw5mjgR3BZV5rkc2ju6NHXpGnp): Thanks. Another noob question - how to download the offline version? It's seems like the answer to this question should be obvious, but I can't figure it out for some reason.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3101_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I think it's a misleading name. I wouldn't know if there was a way.

On theofflinebay.org go on the 'Search' page (next to 'About Us') and it has a torrent link there to download the offline version.  I'm sorry this is not more obvious, I will fix it next update. Thanks.

> [bats](#comment_111_1QvU5RXqw5mjgR3BZV5rkc2ju6NHXpGnp): Thanks! I suppose the dynamic information shown on search results such as age, seeds, leeches, etc. is still fetched 'online'?

No, that is all part of the database torrent.  All the information is up to date when I create the database.  The database date of creation is at the bottom of the page (2021.04.16 for the offline version).

> [mcfly](#comment_1_1Pwfa1nqsLmPU66uBJRkdvUBZoJdeE1PcV): Yo, I try to share as often as I can ;) Did you share the 2 files, here, on Zeronet? (on Zeroup and ZeroUp Unlimited)Thanks a lot!

Thanks! No I didn't share those files.

> [sarkozizi](#comment_4_16ANkHsczDJfSc8YeKYG3nGi8uGNzCmmU9): Hey! good job! The website is offline today. But don't worry, I already downloaded those files. They are online 24/7 ;)I will upload the files on ZeroUp and ZeroUp Unlimited.Have a nice day!

Thanks, it's back up now. Had a problem with certificates.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1044_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): May be handy to know rough database size, if too large, maybe i should not bother figuring out how to install webtorrent client on my Linux just to seed this DB (if not possible to seed via classic BT trackers, not just wss:). Maybe the offline version of the site and DB seeding should be better promoted, so noob people know what to do when the site is not working.

The standalone version (no internet required) is 700MB and the P2P database (WebTorrent) is 2.2GB.
The infohash of the standalone version is  f87e7d05996e5cc13d6d0246cc0939f678a81865  so just download it in any torrent client and then open  '_The Offline Bay' (.html) within the downloaded torrent.
I'll improve clarity next update. Thanks for the feedback.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1045_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): so if i download it not via web torrent, then the site can not use me as a peer, but i can still serve as a seeder for the volunteers who want to seed the whole db by downloading this torrent? (yes, it goes via DHT, so wss not needed)

Yes you're right about that.
Yes, it is a cold backup and it will not have the latest torrents or peer counts, but still useful to find content as older popular torrents usually remain popular.  I update it every so often, and that requires people to download the new database torrent. (They can continue using the old version if they like)

There are two versions of the website, P2P and Offline. I understand it is not very clear at the moment, I will address this in the next update.

The 2.2GB database torrent is for the P2P version only.  This can be access via theofflinebay.org or via a locally saved .html copy of theofflinebay.org. To save this .html file on your computer, go to theofflinebay.org and:
1) right click
2) save page as
3) save as type: 'Web Page, HTML only'

The 700MB offline version is completely standalone using 7,125 files to store the database. You can download this as a torrent (link on the offlinebay.org), and access it using the file '_The Offline Bay.html', which is part of the download.

> [xcang](#comment_1_1AS2HZu9F9R2rW8cuwr1cofqS28j9WhQty): Where are you gathering torrents? [...]

Initially from as many dumps as I could find, but since the new year I scrape the DHT only.  The database hasn't been updated for a month so you won't have anything recent.  I'll have a live version available soon that will be updated in real time that should have all of those torrents.

> [j4s0f](#comment_2_172SzEe2eDN1U4swCbnPUbbGjoN9MXMnGQ): https://torlook.info is still better

I'm a happy to admit that theofflinebay isn't the best torrent site, but I want to provide an alternative torrent website which is why I focused on decentralization and being able to download an offline copy. I hope to improve it in time.

> [baduser](#comment_38_1KTDVd4rtqErz3FcxPx2nTmr4CSR9Q7hcr): The decentralized torrent site that goes offline. Uhhhhh

The domain and host are centralized and can suffer from this. To avoid these centralized points, you can save the page's .html file to your desktop by following the steps in my comment from a few days ago.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3125_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I'm wondering why you won't create a ZeroNet version of the site.

1) The core function isn't compatible with ZeroNet and I don't have the time to rewrite it.
2) I don't want the hindrance of requiring ZeroNet or any other software.
I've introduced live search and fixed the points raised here.  Let me know what you think or if you come across any bugs.
